page.title: 08RUSSLEY HOUSE AND STABLES.
page.content: AT SU266803 STANDS AN EARLY VICTORIAN COUNTRY HOUSE OF BRICK AND FLINT.THERE IS EVIDENCE THAT A DWELLING OF SOME KIND HAS OCCUPIED THIS SITE FOR HUNDREDS OF YEARS.IN 1770 PROPERTY LEASED TO A LORD CRAVEN MAY HAVE ENTERTAINED KING JAMES II HERE.FROM THE MID 19C. UNTIL 1962 RUSSLEY KNEW FAME AS A TRAINING GROUND FOR RACEHORSES.COL.W.HALL-WALKER,LATER LORD WAVENTREE AND MR.J.L.-SONNY-HALL BOTH GREAT NAMES IN HORSE RACING CIRCLES HAVE EACH OWNED RUSSLEY THIS CENTURY.ABOUT 40 STABLES ARE STILL STANDING,PLUS COACH HOUSE,GRANARY, STUD GROOMS HOUSE,LADS QUARTERS, GYMNASIUM, TACKROOM AND BLACKSMITHS SHOP SOME BADLY DETIORATED.AFTER A PERIOD OF NEGLECT, THE PROPERTY HAS BEEN SOLD IN LOTS TO VARIOUS PEOPLE WHO ALL SEEM TO HAVE PLANS TO REVIVE IT.
